subject: Add region_name to service_credentials for devstack
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-07 02:11:11.000000000', 'files': ['devstack/plugin.sh'], 'message': "Add region_name to service_credentials for devstack

The devstack plugin should configure region_name in
[service_credentials]. Things work because of the defaults but looking
at other services that talk to services (nova->neutron, heat->everyone)
they all set a region name in their configs. It's already supported by
SL but isn't set in the devstack plugin.

Change-Id: Ic572464d1044e5b7ca5a0c007fbe7f7fbf042f15
Closes-bug: #1566515
"}]
commit_message:
Add region_name to service_credentials for devstack

The devstack plugin should configure region_name in
[service_credentials]. Things work because of the defaults but looking
at other services that talk to services (nova->neutron, heat->everyone)
they all set a region name in their configs. It's already supported by
SL but isn't set in the devstack plugin.

Change-Id: Ic572464d1044e5b7ca5a0c007fbe7f7fbf042f15
Closes-bug: #1566515

commit_message:
Listen to instance volume attach/detach events

Refresh indexed nova servers on cinder volume attach and
detach events. Nova emits its own versions of these events.

Cherry-picking to mitaka since it covers a data inconsistency.

Change-Id: Ie6c36356f2b1a2f45eb9685062d66666ee245cef
Closes-Bug: #1565015
(cherry picked from commit d9b1230ac9e827735858e4d195da4efea052d247)

subject: Restart rsyslogd after logrotate
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 538, 'name': 'Major Hayden', 'email': 'major@mhtx.net', 'username': 'rackerhacker'}, {'_account_id': 12807, 'name': 'Steve Lewis (stevelle)', 'email': 'stevelle@gmail.com', 'username': 'stevelle'}, {'_account_id': 14805, 'name': 'Jimmy McCrory', 'email': 'jimmy.mccrory@gmail.com', 'username': 'jimmy-mccrory'}, {'_account_id': 15993, 'name': 'Amy Marrich', 'display_name': 'Amy Marrich (spotz)', 'email': 'amy@demarco.com', 'username': 'amarrich'}, {'_account_id': 18675, 'name': 'Sharath Rao', 'email': 'sharath.rao@ericsson.com', 'username': 'sharath.rao'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-04 14:42:13.000000000', 'files': ['templates/os_aggregate_storage.j2'], 'message': 'Restart rsyslogd after logrotate

The copytruncate directive in logrotate configuration truncates the log file so
that processes can keep using the same file descriptor to write to the log
file. The truncation, however, does not work well with rsyslog forwarding as
rsyslog fails to figure out the difference from last sent messages.

This change restarts rsyslogd in postrotate directive of logrotate such as
rsyslog will start with a new baseline and continue forwarding logs.

Closes-Bug: 1564654
Change-Id: Ied15bc73e5af78bfcc1430db787b61d65a9bc044
Signed-off-by: Shu Shen <sshen@siaras.com>
(cherry picked from commit 04b8a98f2b818c86b063033e8e74cc704c490a0b)
'}]
commit_message:
Restart rsyslogd after logrotate

The copytruncate directive in logrotate configuration truncates the log file so
that processes can keep using the same file descriptor to write to the log
file. The truncation, however, does not work well with rsyslog forwarding as
rsyslog fails to figure out the difference from last sent messages.

This change restarts rsyslogd in postrotate directive of logrotate such as
rsyslog will start with a new baseline and continue forwarding logs.

Closes-Bug: 1564654
Change-Id: Ied15bc73e5af78bfcc1430db787b61d65a9bc044
Signed-off-by: Shu Shen <sshen@siaras.com>
(cherry picked from commit 04b8a98f2b818c86b063033e8e74cc704c490a0b)

subject: Implement a script to generate Puppetfile
revisions:
[{'number': 11, 'created': '2016-04-07 14:06:10.000000000', 'files': ['generate_puppetfile.sh', 'openstack_modules.txt', 'Puppetfile', 'external_modules.txt'], 'message': "Implement a script to generate Puppetfile

* Implement generate_puppetfile.sh
This script will read from openstack_modules.txt and
external_modules.txt that contain the list of Puppet modules we rely to
run our CI. It will build a Puppetfile by using master for Puppet
OpenStack modules and the latest tag for external modules.

* Remove Puppetfile, that is not useful anymore since it's generated.

* Run the script everytime our CI needs to install modules.
Which means our CI will always test the latests versions of our external
modules.

* Allow to pin modules.
Example:
puppetlabs/puppetlabs-apache,1.8.1

Change-Id: I2d529cc16b335d112f996c9f1f0266f440eab065
"}]
commit_message:
Implement a script to generate Puppetfile

* Implement generate_puppetfile.sh
This script will read from openstack_modules.txt and
external_modules.txt that contain the list of Puppet modules we rely to
run our CI. It will build a Puppetfile by using master for Puppet
OpenStack modules and the latest tag for external modules.

* Remove Puppetfile, that is not useful anymore since it's generated.

* Run the script everytime our CI needs to install modules.
Which means our CI will always test the latests versions of our external
modules.

* Allow to pin modules.
Example:
puppetlabs/puppetlabs-apache,1.8.1

Change-Id: I2d529cc16b335d112f996c9f1f0266f440eab065

subject: Do not run npm shrinkwrap if npm-shrinkwrap.json already exists
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-04-07 19:07:53.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/macros.yaml'], 'message': 'Do not run npm shrinkwrap if npm-shrinkwrap.json already exists

If npm-shrinkwrap.json already exists, it makes no sense to
recreate it - you can always checkout the commit you need and
find which dependencies were actually used.

Related-Bug: #1567494

Change-Id: Id034308119ef6aa01b4e30e3b110d82b238a94b3
'}]
commit_message:
Do not run npm shrinkwrap if npm-shrinkwrap.json already exists

If npm-shrinkwrap.json already exists, it makes no sense to
recreate it - you can always checkout the commit you need and
find which dependencies were actually used.

Related-Bug: #1567494

Change-Id: Id034308119ef6aa01b4e30e3b110d82b238a94b3

commit_message:
Fixes Tempest error caused by tempest's changes

CONF.network.tenant_networks_reachable and CONF.auth.admin_tenant_name
doesn't exist now. It causes Jenkins failure in gerrit.

This patch fixes the failure by changing some deprecated config name.

Change-Id: I61b0c159cda78cfd9a4fe8513383631cb6de77e6

subject: Add retry logic to mysql_upgrade
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-04 13:44:22.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/galera_setup.yml', 'tasks/galera_upgrade_post.yml', 'tasks/galera_running_check.yml'], 'message': 'Add retry logic to mysql_upgrade

This change adds a retry to the mysql_upgrade command when performing
an upgrade. This is required in circumstances when the wsrep service
is not ready for application use. This is a common issue when restarting
the mysql service after package installation.

Example Error:
  Got error: 1047: WSREP has not yet prepared node for application
  use when selecting the database

Change-Id: Icd859531b6a6f1e04ecd1214eb7c401fa0fe8048
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
(cherry picked from commit 8245978ea7acda108b860e8adf64407d0c6e17cf)
'}]
commit_message:
Add retry logic to mysql_upgrade

This change adds a retry to the mysql_upgrade command when performing
an upgrade. This is required in circumstances when the wsrep service
is not ready for application use. This is a common issue when restarting
the mysql service after package installation.

Example Error:
  Got error: 1047: WSREP has not yet prepared node for application
  use when selecting the database

Change-Id: Icd859531b6a6f1e04ecd1214eb7c401fa0fe8048
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
(cherry picked from commit 8245978ea7acda108b860e8adf64407d0c6e17cf)

commit_message:
Bump firewall module to 1.8.0

- The package "iptables-persistent" wasn't installed when facter trying
  to get version. Update of module has Facter.flush method call to clear
  Facter cache.
- checksum_fill functionality was added to recent module which is
  required for security hardening

Change-Id: Ia06981f338b3e1797004e2c5c5b3e52e08f00124
Closes-Bug: 1565683
Signed-off-by: Sergii Golovatiuk <sgolovatiuk@mirantis.com>

commit_message:
Set default iptables INPUT policy to DROP

It was observed that on Fuel master node the default firewall INPUT
policy is set to 'ACCEPT' rather than to 'DROP'.
This leads to exposure of unnecessary services over a potentially
untrusted networks.

This patch updates default firewall INPUT policy to 'DROP'. Also it adds
user-defined chains which are not purged (and thus preserved between
iptables.pp applications).

Change-Id: Ia9ab6d019be81aebcf5eaba25336e6f19b2c6a1a
Partial-Bug: #1524750
Depends-On: I57e9f58c6bad32b23b179499f0514edf5357bd31
Signed-off-by: Maksim Malchuk <mmalchuk@mirantis.com>

commit_message:
Add support of bulk operations for openstack-config

* Add multiple node filter for openstack-config list
* Allow upload config for multiple nodes
* Allow execute config for multiple nodes

Related-Bug: #1557462
Change-Id: I3d964be1dcf1745ab1634b946850c3294fa799d5
(cherry-picked from 54439bbaa346a84e097986b28bed8e076ce292a5)

commit_message:
Add multinode support to openstack config CLIv2

* Option --node accepts list of node ids.
* Improve client library, make many parameters optional.
* Add unit tests for openstack config library code.

subject: Allow plugins to retrieve secrets
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-08 03:38:41.000000000', 'files': ['barbican/api/controllers/secrets.py'], 'message': "Allow plugins to retrieve secrets

To fix bug #1561701, code was added to throw an exception if there
is no 'encrypted_data' on the secret model. However, 'encrypted_data'
will only be found on secrets using the StoreCryptoAdapterPlugin.
Any other plugin will use 'secret_store_metadata' instead. This change
will throw the error only if neither 'encrypted_data' nor
'secret_store_metadata' is found.

Change-Id: I74c00bfab67ca923ade89ad0c713ef95f998c072
"}]
commit_message:
Allow plugins to retrieve secrets

To fix bug #1561701, code was added to throw an exception if there
is no 'encrypted_data' on the secret model. However, 'encrypted_data'
will only be found on secrets using the StoreCryptoAdapterPlugin.
Any other plugin will use 'secret_store_metadata' instead. This change
will throw the error only if neither 'encrypted_data' nor
'secret_store_metadata' is found.

Change-Id: I74c00bfab67ca923ade89ad0c713ef95f998c072

commit_message:
Remove extra loops from upload_cirros script

This change removes the extra loops from the upload_cirros script that
were added while attempting to debug Bug 1556068.  These extra loops
could cause the task to exceed the task timeout and ultimately did not
address the main issue. This change cleans up the extra code that was
added for debugging purposes now that the previous bug has been closed.

Change-Id: I26cfe1d0f6f2f6d8fb2e9fbba2cd964574c7bbef
Closes-Bug: #1563981

commit_message:
Iptables firewall prevent IP spoofed DHCP requests

The DHCP rules in the fixed iptables firewall rules were too permissive.
They permitted any UDP traffic with a source port of 68 and destination
port of 67. Care must be taken since these rules return before the IP
spoofing prevention rules. This patch splits the fixed DHCP rules into
two, one for the discovery and request messages which take place before
the instance has bound an IP address and a second to permit DHCP
renewals.

Change-Id: Ibc2b0fa80baf2ea8b01fa568cd1fe7a7e092e7a5
Partial-Bug: #1558658

subject: Do not append netmaks suffix to IPV6 addresses
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-04-06 16:05:51.000000000', 'files': ['os_net_config/tests/test_impl_ifcfg.py', 'os_net_config/impl_ifcfg.py'], 'message': 'Do not append netmaks suffix to IPV6 addresses

In change I31b39abae36e0620dbbcb1001fa51f5ca2bd9ea2 we changed
the behaviour we have with IPv6 addresses and started appending
the netmask to the address we paste into the ifcfg file.

Unfortunately this causes os-net-config to bring down and back up
all the interfaces affected even though it is given as input a
config.json identical to what it had before.

Change-Id: I4353b9d78745e37751f4e84468c128917cb921a0
'}]
commit_message:
Do not append netmaks suffix to IPV6 addresses

In change I31b39abae36e0620dbbcb1001fa51f5ca2bd9ea2 we changed
the behaviour we have with IPv6 addresses and started appending
the netmask to the address we paste into the ifcfg file.

Unfortunately this causes os-net-config to bring down and back up
all the interfaces affected even though it is given as input a
config.json identical to what it had before.

Change-Id: I4353b9d78745e37751f4e84468c128917cb921a0

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-08 12:38:03.000000000', 'files': ['gates_tests/helpers/utils.py'], 'message': 'Do not raise exception for ostf status check

We switch gate test to usage of ssh_manager,
where raise exception if exit code =! 0 is set by default.
But when we stop ostf service, systemctl status ostf never return 0,
so that we got false negative results.

Change-Id: I9dfb2501921dae8b1ce84a71de8ca794d227daed
Closes-Bug: #1567889
'}]
commit_message:
Do not raise exception for ostf status check

We switch gate test to usage of ssh_manager,
where raise exception if exit code =! 0 is set by default.
But when we stop ostf service, systemctl status ostf never return 0,
so that we got false negative results.

Change-Id: I9dfb2501921dae8b1ce84a71de8ca794d227daed
Closes-Bug: #1567889

commit_message:
Do not raise exception for ostf status check

We switch gate test to usage of ssh_manager,
where raise exception if exit code =! 0 is set by default.
But when we stop ostf service, systemctl status ostf never return 0,
so that we got false negative results.

Change-Id: I9dfb2501921dae8b1ce84a71de8ca794d227daed
Closes-Bug: #1567889

commit_message:
Fix metric dimensions having only key

When metric dimensions have only key, query parameter will be ending with
':' delimiter. But api can not handle this query parameter.
So change to eliminate ':' delimiter when metric dimensions have only key.

Change-Id: I1327f8fe641fe98cf16c28911ef19908468d1bc0

commit_message:
Refactor array values processing

We have different strategies in handling list
values. This patch is bringing the situation
to the consistent state in this question.
Arrays and csv-strings are allowed.
This allows to put this logic inside oslo module
and clean up code duplication in exterior modules
(which can just pass parameters to oslo).
Also patch bring a few updates to top-file docs
and tests.

Change-Id: I37a37d236e643d3cf39b46243119b8393a3feea7

subject: Glance wrapper: De-obfuscate image fetching
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 4428, 'name': 'Liyingjun', 'email': 'yinjalee@163.com', 'username': 'liyingjun'}, {'_account_id': 6172, 'name': 'Boris Pavlovic', 'email': 'boris@pavlovic.me', 'username': 'boris-42'}, {'_account_id': 7369, 'name': 'Sergey Skripnick', 'email': 'sskripnick@mirantis.com', 'username': 'redixin'}, {'_account_id': 8491, 'name': 'Illia Khudoshyn', 'email': 'ikhudoshyn@mirantis.com', 'username': 'ikhudoshyn'}, {'_account_id': 11748, 'name': 'Chris St. Pierre', 'email': 'cstpierr@cisco.com', 'username': 'stpierre'}, {'_account_id': 12395, 'name': 'Roman Vasylets', 'email': 'pomeo92@gmail.com', 'username': 'rvasilets'}, {'_account_id': 12637, 'name': 'Srinivas Sakhamuri', 'email': 'srini.openstack@gmail.com', 'username': 'srsakhamuri'}, {'_account_id': 14817, 'name': 'Mirantis Rally CI', 'email': 'rally-ci@mirantis.com', 'username': 'ci50'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-04-06 12:42:38.000000000', 'files': ['rally/plugins/openstack/context/glance/images.py', 'tests/unit/plugins/openstack/context/glance/test_images.py', 'tests/unit/plugins/openstack/cleanup/test_resources.py', 'rally/plugins/openstack/wrappers/glance.py', 'rally/plugins/openstack/cleanup/resources.py', 'tests/unit/plugins/openstack/wrappers/test_glance.py'], 'message': 'Glance wrapper: De-obfuscate image fetching

Formerly there were two ways to fetch images: From an image object
using the Glance wrapper get_image() function; or from the image ID
directly with the API in a version-agnostic way. This led to confusion
and a bug in the Images context.

This commit removes the get_image() function so there is one canonical
way to fetch an image: by ID from the API, without getting the wrapper
involved.

Change-Id: Ib7b5bf3b84ba72ee8a3b7f8f2426a6513db27d44
'}]
commit_message:
Glance wrapper: De-obfuscate image fetching

Formerly there were two ways to fetch images: From an image object
using the Glance wrapper get_image() function; or from the image ID
directly with the API in a version-agnostic way. This led to confusion
and a bug in the Images context.

This commit removes the get_image() function so there is one canonical
way to fetch an image: by ID from the API, without getting the wrapper
involved.

Change-Id: Ib7b5bf3b84ba72ee8a3b7f8f2426a6513db27d44

commit_message:
Fix trivial issues during py3 work

1. mistype: ParamField(defaul='') -> ParamField(default='')
2. from functools import reduce (cross compatible py2 & py3)
3. with file -> with open
4. iteritems() -> items() as discussed about six.iteritems vs items
5. @transaction.commit_on_success -> @transaction.atomic (deprecated)
6. from contextlib import nested -> deprecated
7. from six.moves import xrange
8. from __future__ import print_function
9. super() call added in required places
10: iterators

blueprint fuel-qa-python3-compatibility

Change-Id: I38aefe759d92a29d50eea0211a6e69e390a4ce67

subject: Copies get_share_capacity_info to diskutils
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-05 14:50:29.000000000', 'files': ['os_win/utils/storage/diskutils.py', 'os_win/utils/storage/smbutils.py', 'os_win/utils/hostutils.py', 'os_win/tests/utils/storage/test_diskutils.py'], 'message': 'Copies get_share_capacity_info to diskutils

The current method from hostutils used to retireve
the disk capacity info only works for drive-letter and not
for file shares given by UNC paths. This patch copies the
get_share_capacity_info method from smbutils to diskutils
and renames it to get_disk_capacity, since it works for both
UNC paths and normal paths.

The method will remain duplicated in both diskutils and
smbutils until all calls will be removed from master and
replaced with the one in diskutils in a subsequent patch.
(i.e Cinder SMB driver)

Closes-Bug: #1563877

Change-Id: I77be6fc2e5989b21ef0b9e97da25fa77d506211e
(cherry picked from commit d073b7f338824fb02baf2d158ec11d945e47b8d1)
'}]
commit_message:
Copies get_share_capacity_info to diskutils

The current method from hostutils used to retireve
the disk capacity info only works for drive-letter and not
for file shares given by UNC paths. This patch copies the
get_share_capacity_info method from smbutils to diskutils
and renames it to get_disk_capacity, since it works for both
UNC paths and normal paths.

The method will remain duplicated in both diskutils and
smbutils until all calls will be removed from master and
replaced with the one in diskutils in a subsequent patch.
(i.e Cinder SMB driver)

Closes-Bug: #1563877

Change-Id: I77be6fc2e5989b21ef0b9e97da25fa77d506211e
(cherry picked from commit d073b7f338824fb02baf2d158ec11d945e47b8d1)

Currently devstack assumes that the cleaning network will be
the private network. This prevents the use of provider and
public networks to be used for the cleaning network, which is
useful when deploying to actual hardware. This patch adds
the IRONIC_CLEAN_NET_NAME var which allows other networks to
be specified.

Change-Id: I5006dbe9f1cf674e5df4baad6646d827cf362c55
'}]
commit_message:
Allow user to specify cleaning network

Currently devstack assumes that the cleaning network will be
the private network. This prevents the use of provider and
public networks to be used for the cleaning network, which is
useful when deploying to actual hardware. This patch adds
the IRONIC_CLEAN_NET_NAME var which allows other networks to
be specified.

Change-Id: I5006dbe9f1cf674e5df4baad6646d827cf362c55

commit_message:
Set gcache.size to static value

- gcache.size shouldn't be calculated based on number of nodes. It's
  been set statically to 512M which is 2-4 hour of maintanance window.
  It should be enough to perform a maintenance. However, user may
  override the value in hiera
- Disable binlog as it was disabled and was enabled during debug session

Change-Id: I4e6cead09e3472fa570cef343532905f7da9b5ba
Closes-Bug: 1566440
Signed-off-by: Sergii Golovatiuk <sgolovatiuk@mirantis.com>

Imported Translations from Zanata

commit_message:
Update hiera_config to parse plugins as a list of hashes

Plugins are listed in hiera now with the following format:
- plugins:
  - name: pluginname
    repositories:
      - name: plugin-name-1.0
        priority: 1100
        ...
   - name: plugin2
   ...

It is necessary to update how hiera_config finds plugin names
because they are stored in the name key now.

Change-Id: I67b06b46d56892bfab3d39cd98bee35bfdac06a0
Partial-Bug: #1565061
(cherry picked from commit 06707b792c7104d6340359631e41cf17105897a5)

[{'number': 17, 'created': '2016-04-07 10:47:39.000000000', 'files': ['nailgun/nailgun/api/v1/validators/orchestrator_graph.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/task/task.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/test/integration/test_orchestrator_handlers.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/orchestrator/orchestrator_graph.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/test/base.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/test/unit/test_graph_serializer.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/test/unit/test_task.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/test/integration/test_graph_related_handlers.py'], 'message': 'Remove legacy graph checker

Earlier, we had only one deployment engine called
granular_deployment or role-based deployment.
It constructed a deployment graph in Nailgun and
did its sanity checking twice - before
deployment task starts and when the graph is contsructed.
Now, when we have task-based deployment by default with which
Astute does graph sanity checking, this check cannot be done
before task starts as engine choice is made now within the deployment
serializer. So, now we have 2 ways of doing this - call an engine, RBD
will call corresponding tasks serializer which will do graph acyclic check.

Change-Id: If081ce7a462bc5ced9459ba619d26aecf22f4916
Closes-bug: #1560555
'}]
commit_message:
Remove legacy graph checker

Earlier, we had only one deployment engine called
granular_deployment or role-based deployment.
It constructed a deployment graph in Nailgun and
did its sanity checking twice - before
deployment task starts and when the graph is contsructed.
Now, when we have task-based deployment by default with which
Astute does graph sanity checking, this check cannot be done
before task starts as engine choice is made now within the deployment
serializer. So, now we have 2 ways of doing this - call an engine, RBD
will call corresponding tasks serializer which will do graph acyclic check.

Change-Id: If081ce7a462bc5ced9459ba619d26aecf22f4916
Closes-bug: #1560555

commit_message:
Add qcow2 format when copy image to a gluster volume

Currently when we create a volume from an image it's type is
always set as raw. The type for the volume should update
according to the configuration of the glusterfs_qcow2_volumes
rather than default raw format.

Change-Id: Ic9d3fbbdc34f7dc1b8a240a99b5e0eccf7cc965b
Closes-Bug: #1516227

commit_message:
Added handlers for resetting settings to previous state

- '/clusters/(?P<cluster_id>\d+)/attributes/reset/deployed?$'
  Reset cluster attributes to previous deployed
- '/clusters/(?P<cluster_id>\d+)/network_configuration/reset/deployed?$'
  Reset network confuguration to previous deployed
Also fixed tracking changes of network configuration

Change-Id: I76d6f8507ee91938959a1251bb4992878610c501
Partial-Bug: 1564953
Closes-Bug: 1566255

commit_message:
Create users only on primary controller

We only need to create the users on the primary controller as all of
/var/lib/mysql is transferred during SST. By restricting the creation of
the users on the primary controller, we are reducing the likelihood of a
split brain that can occur when the MyISAM tables become desynced.

Change-Id: I732400137dd4d6ede72c18a595a3b2fd295621d3
Closes-Bug: #1548271
Signed-off-by: Sergii Golovatiuk <sgolovatiuk@mirantis.com>

commit_message:
Remove the update function of container

The container update function isn't called by any function.
So we should delete it.

commit_message:
Deprecate manila-all command

/usr/local/bin/manila-all purports to start all the manila
services within a single process.  We should deprecate this
command since to do this in production would be a very bad
idea - completely un-"cloudy" - and we don't even do it in
devstack.

Implements blueprint deprecate-manila-all

Change-Id: I0ac0c699071324b218f63422354a871b7fa3b81e

commit_message:
Ensure metadata agent doesn't use SSL for UNIX socket

The communication between the ns metadata proxy and the metadata agent
is pure HTTP, and should not switch to HTTPS when neutron is using SSL.

We're therefore telling wsgi.Server to forcefully disable SSL in that
case.

Change-Id: I2cb9fa231193bcd5c721c4d5cf0eb9c16e842349
Closes-Bug: #1514424
(cherry picked from commit 7a306e2918775ebb94d9e1408aaa2b7c3ed26fc6)

subject: Update flake8 constraints
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-11 22:47:25.000000000', 'files': ['global-requirements.txt'], 'message': "Update flake8 constraints

The enable-extensions option added in flake8 2.5.0 was previously only
available via the command-line flag --enable-extensions. Starting in
2.5.4, it is also available via a config option in tox.ini's [flake8]
section. This allows projects to enable off-by-default checks in the
normal, expected location. This in turn allows users to run flake8
directly, rather than running `tox -e pep8` .

Change-Id: I04b862ced4659dfeb3c515edb3b8fed36b5b086d
"}]
commit_message:
Update flake8 constraints

The enable-extensions option added in flake8 2.5.0 was previously only
available via the command-line flag --enable-extensions. Starting in
2.5.4, it is also available via a config option in tox.ini's [flake8]
section. This allows projects to enable off-by-default checks in the
normal, expected location. This in turn allows users to run flake8
directly, rather than running `tox -e pep8` .

Change-Id: I04b862ced4659dfeb3c515edb3b8fed36b5b086d

commit_message:
Set SELinux mode to permissive mode

Our new centos-7 dibs have SELinux set to Enforcing by default. Since
kolla doesn't support SELinux out of the box, we need to set it to
permissive mode.

Change-Id: I91028a036848c051a179eb7dda06b048d5bf7877
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Add possiblity to use generator in environment config

It should be possible to use generators in
environment config. However validation schema
doesn't allow it.
Nailgun doesn't contain such scheme because
validation take place after all values have been
generated

Change-Id: Iff2feb7357afff02793deee65b6c65072914739c
Closes-Bug: #1557562

Change hugepages and cpu pinning to integer

There are plenty of problems with converting.
Since UI can work with type of number,
node attributes can be changed to number type.

Previously all testing of the PUT method assumed that a body existed,

api-wg spec specifies an interface with tags that uses PUT with no

commit_message:
allow samples testing for PUT to not have a body

Previously all testing of the PUT method assumed that a body existed,
which is implied by the HTTP spec, but not strictly stated. The tags
api-wg spec specifies an interface with tags that uses PUT with no
payload.

This makes our _do_put able to handle that case, and removes empty
templates when not needed.

Change-Id: I3d869d63affd08e321944c0082ee9865124d38e2

commit_message:
Switch from RUN: to HIERA: annotation

* RUN annotation caused duplication for tasks in the old folder
* RUN should only be used if you need non-standard run configuration

Change-Id: Idadddaf41a6604d1f60a8357e072665ce7e00122

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-04 16:29:18.000000000', 'files': ['ironic_python_agent/tests/unit/test_inspector.py', 'ironic_python_agent/inspector.py'], 'message': 'Set modification time in tarfile of ramdisk logs

If we do not set this explicitly, tar will warn "journal: implausibly

commit_message:
Set modification time in tarfile of ramdisk logs

If we do not set this explicitly, tar will warn "journal: implausibly
old time stamp" when the user tries to untar the log files.

Change-Id: I4a5a1ffd4eeca9697cdcf16e02d3ff3c22d7132c

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-04-08 07:54:59.000000000', 'files': ['rally/plugins/openstack/scenarios/tempest/utils.py', 'tests/unit/plugins/openstack/scenarios/tempest/test_utils.py'], 'message': 'Convert task execution time to float value

For tempest scenario test, task execution time extracted from tempest
log is a string rather than a number value. This causes type validation

Change-Id: I95efb88c57b2d57609ad9a3934632c118b995301

commit_message:
Convert task execution time to float value

For tempest scenario test, task execution time extracted from tempest
log is a string rather than a number value. This causes type validation
error when task engine parses the task result. This patch fixes this
issue by converting this value to float type.

Change-Id: I95efb88c57b2d57609ad9a3934632c118b995301
Closes-Bug: #1566712

commit_message:
Test: Distinguish expected added resources

Some resources can't be cleaned up (default security groups) and some
shouldn't be (the _member_ role), so we filter those out of the added
resources and report them separately.

Change-Id: Ibb601f59df509895b438ac142cd8811df3e1d956

commit_message:
Merge tag '8.0.0'

This is a null-merge of the 8.0.0 release tag back into the master
branch so that the 8.0.0 tag will appear in the git commit history of
the master branch. It contains no actual changes to the master branch,
regardless of how our code review system's UI represents it. Please
ask in #openstack-infra if you have any questions, and otherwise try
to merge this as quickly as possible to avoid later conflicts on the
master branch.

Change-Id: I0b8fef4b44eb8375daf361f676997ae83347b5a0

subject: Disable Nova v3 API
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-01 16:35:23.000000000', 'files': ['network/endpoints/endpoint_map.yaml', 'network/endpoints/endpoint_data.yaml', 'puppet/hieradata/controller.yaml'], 'message': "Disable Nova v3 API

Microversions since Nova API v2.1 are aimed to replace the v3 work. The
/v2.1 is backwards compatible with the legacy /v2 endpoint. What we
called in the past /v3 is now something defunct in-tree. The /v2.1 API
is based on the v3 work, but there are many things that differ, in
particular with the backwards-compat thing. We keep the /v2 path in
api-paste.ini for making sure an upgrade doesn't trample operators and
users but if you look in tree, that's redirecting to the v2.1
codepath (just not asking for microversions). In summary, we only need
one endpoint, ie. /v2.1.

Additional information at https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1291291

Related-Bug: #1564372
Change-Id: I1654665663bc5a19c201f7d25407910654ac1308
Depends-On: I6d64b8bcd0f79f1f298ddc809e6d92fbc2985c45
(cherry picked from commit b239b6216f1fb6791ab717ffe400a463f269c9d8)
"}]
commit_message:
Disable Nova v3 API

Microversions since Nova API v2.1 are aimed to replace the v3 work. The
/v2.1 is backwards compatible with the legacy /v2 endpoint. What we
called in the past /v3 is now something defunct in-tree. The /v2.1 API
is based on the v3 work, but there are many things that differ, in
particular with the backwards-compat thing. We keep the /v2 path in
api-paste.ini for making sure an upgrade doesn't trample operators and
users but if you look in tree, that's redirecting to the v2.1
codepath (just not asking for microversions). In summary, we only need
one endpoint, ie. /v2.1.

Additional information at https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1291291

Related-Bug: #1564372
Change-Id: I1654665663bc5a19c201f7d25407910654ac1308
Depends-On: I6d64b8bcd0f79f1f298ddc809e6d92fbc2985c45
(cherry picked from commit b239b6216f1fb6791ab717ffe400a463f269c9d8)

subject: Add logic to NOT build "proprietary" packages
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-07 18:23:08.000000000', 'files': ['lookup/py_pkgs.py'], 'message': 'Add logic to NOT build "proprietary" packages

This change simply adds a case statement to the known
packages to build where it will NOT build a proprietary
package. This change is being made in support of OSA being
able to deploy closed source software.

To support proprietary packages the a new method named
"_package_build_index" was added and a loop was added the
original "_process_files" method. These changes allow
the plugin to index all packages and in a given variable file
and then find the any package that is proprietary. If the
proprietary package has a coresponding known git repo
assosiated with it the package will be added to the build list
otherwise it will simply be skipped and it will be up to the
deployer to make the closed source software available to the
deployment.

Change-Id: I75a29f710aa65c13c3067c06c02b951e44a38161
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
(cherry picked from commit c962fd2218ae336cbd31f777a18acc501c2b2d47)

commit_message:
Add logic to NOT build "proprietary" packages

This change simply adds a case statement to the known
packages to build where it will NOT build a proprietary
package. This change is being made in support of OSA being
able to deploy closed source software.

To support proprietary packages the a new method named
"_package_build_index" was added and a loop was added the
original "_process_files" method. These changes allow
the plugin to index all packages and in a given variable file
and then find the any package that is proprietary. If the
proprietary package has a coresponding known git repo
assosiated with it the package will be added to the build list
otherwise it will simply be skipped and it will be up to the
deployer to make the closed source software available to the
deployment.

Change-Id: I75a29f710aa65c13c3067c06c02b951e44a38161
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
(cherry picked from commit c962fd2218ae336cbd31f777a18acc501c2b2d47)

commit_message:
Make L3 HA interface creation concurrency safe

This patch creates a function to handle the creation of the
L3HA interfaces for a router in a manner that handles the
HA network not existing or an existing one being  deleted
by another worker before the interfaces could be created.

Closes-Bug: #1548285
Change-Id: Ibac0c366362aa76615e448fbe11d6d6b031732fe
(cherry-picked from commit 7512d8aa26a945a695e889e0a97c6414cec6ac10)

subject: Disable Nova v3 API
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-01 16:32:02.000000000', 'files': ['network/endpoints/endpoint_map.yaml', 'network/endpoints/endpoint_data.yaml', 'puppet/hieradata/controller.yaml'], 'message': "Disable Nova v3 API

Microversions since Nova API v2.1 are aimed to replace the v3 work. The
/v2.1 is backwards compatible with the legacy /v2 endpoint. What we
called in the past /v3 is now something defunct in-tree. The /v2.1 API
is based on the v3 work, but there are many things that differ, in
particular with the backwards-compat thing. We keep the /v2 path in
api-paste.ini for making sure an upgrade doesn't trample operators and
users but if you look in tree, that's redirecting to the v2.1
codepath (just not asking for microversions). In summary, we only need
one endpoint, ie. /v2.1.

Additional information at https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1291291

Related-Bug: #1564372
Change-Id: I1654665663bc5a19c201f7d25407910654ac1308
Depends-On: I6d64b8bcd0f79f1f298ddc809e6d92fbc2985c45
(cherry picked from commit b239b6216f1fb6791ab717ffe400a463f269c9d8)
"}]
commit_message:
Disable Nova v3 API

Microversions since Nova API v2.1 are aimed to replace the v3 work. The
/v2.1 is backwards compatible with the legacy /v2 endpoint. What we
called in the past /v3 is now something defunct in-tree. The /v2.1 API
is based on the v3 work, but there are many things that differ, in
particular with the backwards-compat thing. We keep the /v2 path in
api-paste.ini for making sure an upgrade doesn't trample operators and
users but if you look in tree, that's redirecting to the v2.1
codepath (just not asking for microversions). In summary, we only need
one endpoint, ie. /v2.1.

Additional information at https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1291291

Related-Bug: #1564372
Change-Id: I1654665663bc5a19c201f7d25407910654ac1308
Depends-On: I6d64b8bcd0f79f1f298ddc809e6d92fbc2985c45
(cherry picked from commit b239b6216f1fb6791ab717ffe400a463f269c9d8)

commit_message:
Ignore exception when deleting linux bridge if doesn't exist

Linux bridge is not handling RuntimeError exception when it is trying
to delete network's bridge, which is deleted in parallel by nova.
Fullstack test has similar scenario, it creates network's bridge for
agent and deletes the bridge after the test, like nova.

Linux bridge agent has to ignore RuntimeError exception if the bridge
doesn't exist.

Closes-bug: #1561040
Change-Id: I428384fd42181ff6bc33f29369a7ff5ec163b532
(cherry picked from commit 16b2ffdfd85eece8fb57a98d10bf35ad617d235a)

commit_message:
Do not log contents of the download request

keystonesession client logs contents of every request in debug mode by
default. It makes little sense if any to log contents of a zip archive
being downloaded.

Change-Id: I9a7d5bda4f290e120638079fbac9e5551b7dee73
Closes-Bug: #1558702
(cherry picked from commit 061b8ea310f4b5377b4df69064ff1d171ba46956)

subject: Restore cinder native backup pass right params and call right api
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-04-07 14:21:12.000000000', 'files': ['freezer/openstack/restore.py', 'freezer/tests/commons.py'], 'message': 'Restore cinder native backup pass right params and call right api

Currently the RestoreJob call restore_cinder with wrong order,
redefine restore_cinder params in right order.

In the restore_cinder, it called cinderclient.backups.findall,
it does not work well. Replace it by cinderclient.backups.list.

Change-Id: I7efca333ab2cd1286e515df2cdb7e52a663e95ac
Closes-Bug: #1563771
'}]
commit_message:
Restore cinder native backup pass right params and call right api

Currently the RestoreJob call restore_cinder with wrong order,
redefine restore_cinder params in right order.

In the restore_cinder, it called cinderclient.backups.findall,
it does not work well. Replace it by cinderclient.backups.list.

Change-Id: I7efca333ab2cd1286e515df2cdb7e52a663e95ac
Closes-Bug: #1563771

commit_message:
ovs-fw: Mark conntrack entries invalid if no rule is matched

This patch makes sure that existing connection breaks once security
group rule that allowed such connection is removed. Due to correctly
track connections on the same hypervisor, zones were changed from
per-port to per-network (based on port's vlan tag). This information is
now stored in register 6. Also there was added a test for RELATED
connections to avoid marking such connection as invalid by REPLY rules.

Closes-Bug: 1549370
Change-Id: Ibb5942a980ddd8f2dd7ac328e9559a80c05789bb
(cherry picked from commit 4f6aa3ffde2fd68b85bc5dfdaf6c2684931f3f61)

commit_message:
l3: Send notify on router_create when ext gw is specified

A router that got created with an external gateway specified now
triggers a notfiy_router_updated event. This triggers scheduling
of the router and creation of the network namespace on the target
node.

Change-Id: I7f6ff5edf6a9c5ffa6d8978c1f3de0e106b6a8bb
Closes-Bug: #1535707
(cherry picked from commit da00d1a186c55c91887c9546e893f6d075a2c2ad)

Accordind specs and docs, SRIOV_NIC.physical_device_mappings is not

physnet could be managed by many NICs.

(cherry picked from commit 46ddaf4288a1cac44d8afc0525b4ecb3ae2186a3)
'}]
commit_message:
Allow to use several nics for physnet with SR-IOV

Accordind specs and docs, SRIOV_NIC.physical_device_mappings is not
limited to be a 1-1 mapping between physnets and NICs. However,
implementation requires this. This bugfix unlocks 1-M mappings, so one
physnet could be managed by many NICs.

* introduced unique_keys in neutron.utils.parse_mappings
* SRIOV_NIC.physical_device_mappings is parsed as dict with lists as
  values with parse_mappings(..., unique_keys=False)

DocImpact
Change-Id: I07b8682fdfe8389a35893cc662b87c94a00bd4a5
Closes-Bug: #1558626
(cherry picked from commit 46ddaf4288a1cac44d8afc0525b4ecb3ae2186a3)

commit_message:
Pkg installation to ssh_remote

Added methods in InstanceInteropHelper class to help reduce
duplicating code
install_packages() installs a given list of packages
update_repository() updates the package repository
get_os_distrib() grabs the name of the OS Distro
Also refactored NotImplementedException to be able to modify
the exception message when passed in a message template
also refactored NotImplementedException
Modified

Change-Id: I8381f7e6c088cb82837fdc873c78722989630b59
Closes-Bug: #1498496

commit_message:
Blacklist Routes 2.3

Routes 2.3 was released today and breaks Trove in liberty, mitaka and
master. I will be pushing this change into liberty and mitaka as
well. This will block it on both python 2.7 and !2.7.

See also Icae2266a66afa53e941254d5fc212fa2536178df

Change-Id: I011c234cf95ab5d5366ad299d04e2a51359c955a

subject: Fix NoneType with no subnet allocation ranges
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-08 10:03:26.000000000', 'files': ['library/neutron'], 'message': 'Fix NoneType with no subnet allocation ranges

When creating a subnet, we retrieve the allocation_ranges from the
variables dict with a default value of "". This should then be fine for
various string operations. The problems is that ansible defaults
varialbes that aren't supplied to None. This means they are present in
the variables dict so don't get the default value of "".

To fix this the code that parses allocation_ranges is wrapped in an
additional conditional.

Change-Id: Ie0310c3da050336ed9b5f5d8fc02e3a4d704491d
'}]
commit_message:
Fix NoneType with no subnet allocation ranges

When creating a subnet, we retrieve the allocation_ranges from the
variables dict with a default value of "". This should then be fine for
various string operations. The problems is that ansible defaults
varialbes that aren't supplied to None. This means they are present in
the variables dict so don't get the default value of "".

To fix this the code that parses allocation_ranges is wrapped in an
additional conditional.

Change-Id: Ie0310c3da050336ed9b5f5d8fc02e3a4d704491d

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-23 15:21:02.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/db/agentschedulers_db.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/db/test_agentschedulers_db.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/scheduler/test_dhcp_agent_scheduler.py', 'neutron/db/l3_agentschedulers_db.py'], 'message': 'Move db query to fetch down bindings under try/except

In case of intermittent DB failures router and network auto-rescheduling
tasks may fail due to error on fetching down bindings from db.
Need to put this queries under try/except to prevent unexpected exit.

Closes-Bug: #1546110
Change-Id: Id48e899a5b3d906c6d1da4d03923bdda2681cd92
(cherry picked from commit b6ec40cbf754de9d189f843cbddfca67d4103ee3)
'}]
commit_message:
Move db query to fetch down bindings under try/except

In case of intermittent DB failures router and network auto-rescheduling
tasks may fail due to error on fetching down bindings from db.
Need to put this queries under try/except to prevent unexpected exit.

Closes-Bug: #1546110
Change-Id: Id48e899a5b3d906c6d1da4d03923bdda2681cd92
(cherry picked from commit b6ec40cbf754de9d189f843cbddfca67d4103ee3)

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-04-08 11:02:40.000000000', 'files': ['heat/engine/clients/os/heat_plugin.py', 'heat/engine/clients/os/cinder.py', 'heat/engine/resources/openstack/heat/wait_condition_handle.py', 'heat/tests/openstack/heat/test_waitcondition.py', 'heat/engine/clients/os/nova.py', 'heat/tests/openstack/cinder/test_volume_utils.py', 'heat/engine/resources/volume_base.py'], 'message': 'Add --insecure in CURL if set True in client option

The CURL attribute is offen used as part of the user
data to signal back to heat in wait handle. If the
insecure option is set True in the clients_heat option,
we need to add --insecure to the CURL url to make it work.

Closes-Bug: #1505958

commit_message:
Add --insecure in CURL if set True in client option

The CURL attribute is offen used as part of the user
data to signal back to heat in wait handle. If the
insecure option is set True in the clients_heat option,
we need to add --insecure to the CURL url to make it work.

Change-Id: Ic5b1331ad3c4042c2d5c7bd2f6b5b6dde5990457
Closes-Bug: #1505958

commit_message:
Update bond properties depending on DPDK status

Bond should have 'ovs' type if DPDK is enabled on it,
and 'linux' type in case of disabled DPDK.

Closes-Bug: #1566312

Change-Id: I555a603fc53deaf38d801b55631ef496ccff004b

commit_message:
Remove unsupported commands

Only commands to backup and restore the Fuel Master node
are supported at the moment. Remove all unsupported commands
from the list of handlers. They will be added back when support
is provided.

Change-Id: I7c6938baac34b6c2e9517bb516332769a100a725
Blueprint: create-standalone-script-to-backup-masternode

revisions:
[{'number': 10, 'created': '2016-04-05 22:59:00.000000000', 'files': ['tests/noop/spec/hosts/openstack-controller/openstack-controller_spec.rb', 'deployment/puppet/openstack_tasks/manifests/openstack_controller/openstack_controller.pp'], 'message': "Fix notification options specification in controller's nova.conf

This will allow to pass compute.instance.update events from Nova to Ceilometer
nova_hash does not contain key 'notification_driver' so we switched
to 'ceilometer' hash. Option notify_on_state_change was previously not
specified at all but is needed.

Closes-bug: #1566498
Signed-off-by: Andrew Woodward <awoodward@mirantis.com>
Change-Id: I81d9591c582221a6c6535b7aa65cf17c95f13fd9
"}]
commit_message:
Fix notification options specification in controller's nova.conf

This will allow to pass compute.instance.update events from Nova to Ceilometer
nova_hash does not contain key 'notification_driver' so we switched
to 'ceilometer' hash. Option notify_on_state_change was previously not
specified at all but is needed.

Closes-bug: #1566498
Signed-off-by: Andrew Woodward <awoodward@mirantis.com>
Change-Id: I81d9591c582221a6c6535b7aa65cf17c95f13fd9

subject: Filter for local nodes in check_resource function
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-05 16:49:34.000000000', 'files': ['extraconfig/tasks/pacemaker_common_functions.sh'], 'message': 'Filter for local nodes in check_resource function

While having extra customizations inside a TripleO deployed
Pacemaker environment, say you have instance HA with
pacemaker_remoted or you need to configure an external arbitrator
for something, then the status of the resources for remote nodes
is "Stopped".
This leads to failures while, for example, scaling up.
This fixes the way status is checked, filtering just local nodes.

Co-Authored-By: Giulio Fidente <gfidente@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I8dc25f5d7031c265858afd5a266fda5315ae37a0
(cherry picked from commit 05b2a200ca2adc5b34bc1460d350f25f1fc18bbe)
'}]
commit_message:
Filter for local nodes in check_resource function

While having extra customizations inside a TripleO deployed
Pacemaker environment, say you have instance HA with
pacemaker_remoted or you need to configure an external arbitrator
for something, then the status of the resources for remote nodes
is "Stopped".
This leads to failures while, for example, scaling up.
This fixes the way status is checked, filtering just local nodes.

Co-Authored-By: Giulio Fidente <gfidente@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I8dc25f5d7031c265858afd5a266fda5315ae37a0
(cherry picked from commit 05b2a200ca2adc5b34bc1460d350f25f1fc18bbe)

commit_message:
Generate a full backup first time

If there isn't any backup of the specified volume, generate a full backup, but
not an incremental one.

Closes-Bug: #1563245

(cherry picked from commit c62a9da7efc726244db35b7a2a0620b6a605197f)

Change-Id: If30e0292671e2be8d026006986b942206cfd2435

commit_message:
Add routing info to host_info.txt

We get some intermittent failures when trying to ping default gateway on
IPv6, it might be interesting to compare routes on successful
vs. unsuccessful deployments. And having `ip route` output could be
useful for some other debugging in the future too.

Change-Id: I0380e87282f6a65622eafa88f125e7f137f63362

commit_message:
Implement Glance Glare service

Glance V3 experimental API has been removed in Mitaka in
favour of standalone Glance Artifacts Repository (GLARE) API.

This patch adds a new service, haproxy settings and tests.

Change-Id: I1df8b9aa8698619e726ad583a1a5ad6d5d671e07
Closes-bug: #1555697

commit_message:
Fix zuul_cloner errors during tox job setup

Since [1], Tempest is a pip installable package, and that prevents zuul_cloner
to work correctly. This change moves away from the existing logic in tox_install,
and adds tempest as an explicit requirement for the api job. This is in fact
the only tox target that needs Tempest to work.

tox_install.sh has become less important now, but cleanup is left as follow
up, to speed up gate salvation.

[1] I25eac915c977ebaedced66ac896c5dd77259d193

Change-Id: I00d882dde77a687ecb57ec200a34fd96256ad87a
(cherry picked from commit 8a6913c534e39e93640ed99c67e66763a9d1da3c)

commit_message:
Set 'rpc_backend' and 'queue_provider' to 'rabbit'

According to upstream 'rpc_backend' may be one of ['rabbit', 'qpid', 'zmq' ]
or their legacy driver names, i.e. 'nova.openstack.common.rpc.impl_kombu'.
However we set 'queue_provider' to 'rabbitmq' and conditionally change it
to legacy name.

Set 'rpc_backend' and 'queue_provider' to 'rabbit' instead of 'rabbitmq'.

Change-Id: I276fd996671fa3a079a0b10f61dc53e4d31f1cdd
Closes-Bug: #1555284

Following commands are added:

* fuel2 graph upload --plugin plugin_id [--type graph_type] --file tasks.yaml

commit_message:
Add custom graph upload and run support to the Fuel V2 CLI

Following commands are added:

* fuel2 graph upload --env env_id [--type graph_type] --file tasks.yaml

* fuel2 graph upload --release release_id [--type graph_type] --file tasks.yaml

* fuel2 graph upload --plugin plugin_id [--type graph_type] --file tasks.yaml
  --type is optional. ‘default’ graph type with confirmation should be used
  if no type is defined.

* fuel2 graph execute --env env_id [--type graph_type] [--node node_ids]
  Graph execution available only for the environment.

Change-Id: I33b168b7929b10200709efc58fd550f8779b39ae
Partial-Bug: #1563851
DocImpact

commit_message:
Set default iptables INPUT policy to DROP

It was observed that on Fuel master node the default firewall INPUT
policy is set to 'ACCEPT' rather than to 'DROP'.
This leads to exposure of unnecessary services over a potentially
untrusted networks.

This patch updates default firewall INPUT policy to 'DROP'. Also it adds
user-defined chains which are not purged (and thus preserved between
iptables.pp applications).

Change-Id: I40f2cad53587a6025d0824390945962786e63cc7
Partial-Bug: #1524750
Co-Authored-By: Maksim Malchuk <mmalchuk@mirantis.com>
Depends-On: I57e9f58c6bad32b23b179499f0514edf5357bd31

commit_message:
Add yaml2ical release for 0.6.0

The list of changes from 0.5.0 .. 0.6.0:

    3dd31a4 Add functionality to batch the meetings list
    0559b4c Remove argparse from requirements
    f02d892 Add one off events for skipped meetings
    ddf64ae Add support for skipping/excluding meetings
    a8c789d start_date now supported in schedules
    d561ce4 Make help text less OpenStack specific
    81c242b Update docs to indicate requirements and expand example meeting

While we're adding this new library also import the history

Change-Id: I948c7eb8c60368ab477f734ef5bfd64daa919702

[{'number': 7, 'created': '2016-04-07 09:26:29.000000000', 'files': ['policy/team-structure.rst'], 'message': 'Deprecate Fuel-wide CL role

As far as we are on our way to make Fuel even
more modular this patch deprecates the role CL
as a Fuel-wide role. Instead Fuel should become
and aggregator of features that provide independent
components. It should be up to a component team
to decide whether they need formal or informal CL.
It also should be up to them how they make architectural
and planning decisions.

Change-Id: Idc35b37711e329a41501246cd082d34eef1e2207
'}]
commit_message:
Deprecate Fuel-wide CL role

As far as we are on our way to make Fuel even
more modular this patch deprecates the role CL
as a Fuel-wide role. Instead Fuel should become
and aggregator of features that provide independent
components. It should be up to a component team
to decide whether they need formal or informal CL.
It also should be up to them how they make architectural
and planning decisions.

Change-Id: Idc35b37711e329a41501246cd082d34eef1e2207

revisions:

The git source for python2_lxc was necessary before the package was
available on pypi, which it now is:
 - https://pypi.python.org/pypi/lxc-python2

This patch removes the py_from_git role from the functional testing
playbook.

Change-Id: Icdee44fc00546c2e565c7d4233af60d0f1d8adb6
'}]
commit_message:
Remove dependency on python2_lxc git source

The git source for python2_lxc was necessary before the package was
available on pypi, which it now is:
 - https://pypi.python.org/pypi/lxc-python2

This patch removes the py_from_git role from the functional testing
playbook.

Change-Id: Icdee44fc00546c2e565c7d4233af60d0f1d8adb6

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-04-07 14:57:02.000000000', 'files': ['rally/task/processing/charts.py', 'tests/unit/task/processing/test_charts.py'], 'message': '[Reports] Improve results calculation in charts.Table

This patch improves method charts.Table._row_has_results
which is responsible on making desicion whether table row
has some results or it should be filled with "n/a".

There are also extra unit test case in
MainStatsTableTestCase.test_add_iteration_and_render

Change-Id: Ifcb67fefa5bb8569c831010f3d877c4714fdaf3d
'}]
commit_message:
[Reports] Improve results calculation in charts.Table

This patch improves method charts.Table._row_has_results
which is responsible on making desicion whether table row
has some results or it should be filled with "n/a".

There are also extra unit test case in
MainStatsTableTestCase.test_add_iteration_and_render
because this test case actually calls _row_has_results()

Change-Id: Ifcb67fefa5bb8569c831010f3d877c4714fdaf3d

commit_message:
Add a possibility to customize fixtures source

This patch adds a possibility to provide custom git repo, gerrit
repo, branch and gerrit refs for fuel-noop-fixtures. Does not
affect deployment, only noop rspec tests.

Fuel-CI: disable

Docs update: I10a4572b98d715ce1382fc7533847e1c1f16f81b
Closes-bug: #1566220

Change-Id: I492716d21f9c81325a9f75aaf3b7a0894a5e00cf

commit_message:
Add metadata objects for device tagging

This patch series adds the ability for a user to specify a tag to be
applied to a network interface or a disk when booting an instance.
This tag is then exposed through the metadata API. For example, a user
boots a VM with two network interfaces. One is connected to a private
network, the other to the public Internet. There is currently no
direct way to tell which interface is which. Specifying tags allows
the user to distinguish between the two interfaces.

This patch introduces the new metadata objects.

Implements: blueprint virt-device-role-tagging
Co-authored-by: Vladik Romanovsky <vromanso@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I8e7100f83ef8504f19b156283e0ade0fcb37dc56

subject: Change waiting on mariadb.pid
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-05 23:30:10.000000000', 'files': ['ansible/roles/mariadb/tasks/start.yml'], 'message': 'Change waiting on mariadb.pid

Previously the code looked at mariadb.pid, but this seemed
flakey in function.  It seemed racey and prone to failure on
slower connections to a registry.  The original task was
extremely complex and it didnt really verify that the MariaDB
was ready to serve connections.  Use wait_for with a regex
instead.

Change-Id: I3aafac04f03639b08e0ef4d6a9c9e1a4499f000c
Closes-Bug: #1564278
(cherry picked from commit ba4bcdbbe84a42e0346c0e36abf0d1cbc5007444)
'}]
commit_message:
Change waiting on mariadb.pid

Previously the code looked at mariadb.pid, but this seemed
flakey in function.  It seemed racey and prone to failure on
slower connections to a registry.  The original task was
extremely complex and it didnt really verify that the MariaDB
was ready to serve connections.  Use wait_for with a regex
instead.

Change-Id: I3aafac04f03639b08e0ef4d6a9c9e1a4499f000c
Closes-Bug: #1564278
(cherry picked from commit ba4bcdbbe84a42e0346c0e36abf0d1cbc5007444)

commit_message:
Add tag column to vifs and bdm

This patch series adds the ability for a user to specify a tag to be
applied to a network interface or a disk when booting an instance.
This tag is then exposed through the metadata API. For example, a user
boots a VM with two network interfaces. One is connected to a private
network, the other to the public Internet. There is currently no
direct way to tell which interface is which. Specifying tags allows
the user to distinguish between the two interfaces.

This patch contains the database migration to add a 'tag' column to
the virtual_interfaces and block_device_mapping tables as well as the
corresponding change to the VirtualInterface and BlockDeviceMapping
objects.

Implements: blueprint virt-device-role-tagging
Co-authored-by: Vladik Romanovsky <vromanso@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Ic8be3de4e970116772f9b6ce01c55e26b829e6cb

Why now?

commit_message:
Port from optparse to argparse

Why now?

* argparse was introduced in Python 3.2 and back-ported to Python 2.7.
  Until we dropped Python 2.6 support, we were stuck on optparse.

* keystoneauth.loading.cli provides register_argparse_arguments and
  load_from_argparse_arguments helper methods. Now that we're moving
  toward Keystone Session support, argparse seems required.

Closes-Bug: 1553030
Change-Id: I5139fb64a8631a3010680090fd04345f95c55c7b

subject: Replace SELECT FOR UPDATE with optimistic locking
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 333, 'name': 'Isaku Yamahata', 'email': 'isaku.yamahata@gmail.com', 'username': 'yamahata'}, {'_account_id': 6694, 'name': 'rcurran', 'email': 'rcurran@cisco.com', 'username': 'rcurran'}, {'_account_id': 7921, 'name': 'Mike Kolesnik', 'email': 'mkolesni@redhat.com', 'username': 'mkolesni'}, {'_account_id': 8655, 'name': 'Jakub Libosvar', 'email': 'libosvar@redhat.com', 'username': 'jlibosva'}, {'_account_id': 10386, 'name': 'OpenDaylight CI', 'email': 'odl-openstack@opendaylight.org', 'username': 'odl-jenkins', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10870, 'name': 'Livnat Peer', 'email': 'lpeer@redhat.com', 'username': 'lpeer'}, {'_account_id': 11114, 'name': 'yalei wang', 'email': 'yalei.wang@intel.com', 'username': 'yalie'}, {'_account_id': 19348, 'name': 'Oded Shvartz', 'email': 'oshvartz@redhat.com', 'username': 'oshvartz'}, {'_account_id': 20084, 'name': 'Intel networking-odl CI', 'email': 'intel-odl-ci@intel.com', 'username': 'intel-networking-odl-ci'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-04-03 13:59:03.000000000', 'files': ['networking_odl/db/migration/alembic_migrations/versions/newton/expand/43af357fd638_added_version_id_for_optimistic_locking.py', 'networking_odl/db/db.py', 'networking_odl/tests/unit/db/test_db.py', 'networking_odl/db/migration/alembic_migrations/versions/EXPAND_HEAD', 'networking_odl/db/models.py'], 'message': 'Replace SELECT FOR UPDATE with optimistic locking

SELECT FOR UPDATE is not a reliable way of locking DB resources as
it's not supported by DB backends such as Galera DB.
This pessimistic locking mode was already abandoned by the Neutron
project a while ago, and shouldn't be relied on by the ODL driver.

Instead, an optimistic locking method is used where a versioning key
will be used to check if the data is stale or not. Since we're trying
to mark a journal row as 'processing' when locking it, this fits the
optimistic lock paradigm.
Hence, when a row is attempted to be marked as 'processing' the ORM
will check if the row is still valid or stale. In case of a stale row,
we will move on to the next row (or return None as before if no more
pending rows are available). The API of the "get oldest pending row"
is maintained, while gaining a locking method that works uniformly
across various DBMS.

Currently, this is the only place requiring this locking paradigm
since once the row is succesfully marked as 'processing' only the
thread that succeeded will go on to actually process it.
Other places, when encountered in the future, should be handled in a
similar manner.

Change-Id: I35d9179b7a50271ae5af98c67abe86c908968f9f
Signed-off-by: Mike Kolesnik <mkolesni@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Replace SELECT FOR UPDATE with optimistic locking

SELECT FOR UPDATE is not a reliable way of locking DB resources as
it's not supported by DB backends such as Galera DB.
This pessimistic locking mode was already abandoned by the Neutron
project a while ago, and shouldn't be relied on by the ODL driver.

Instead, an optimistic locking method is used where a versioning key
will be used to check if the data is stale or not. Since we're trying
to mark a journal row as 'processing' when locking it, this fits the
optimistic lock paradigm.
Hence, when a row is attempted to be marked as 'processing' the ORM
will check if the row is still valid or stale. In case of a stale row,
we will move on to the next row (or return None as before if no more
pending rows are available). The API of the "get oldest pending row"
is maintained, while gaining a locking method that works uniformly
across various DBMS.

Currently, this is the only place requiring this locking paradigm
since once the row is succesfully marked as 'processing' only the
thread that succeeded will go on to actually process it.
Other places, when encountered in the future, should be handled in a
similar manner.

Change-Id: I35d9179b7a50271ae5af98c67abe86c908968f9f
Signed-off-by: Mike Kolesnik <mkolesni@redhat.com>

subject: Router namespace not created in controller
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-02-11 07:19:03.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/routers/forms.py'], 'message': "Router namespace not created in controller

When creating a router with an external network attached
from the Create Router form a router namespace doesn't
get created on the controller.

By calling the correct APIs, the namespace get
created.

To check the namespace list run the below command
on controller node.
'sudo ip netns list'

Change-Id: I829c707353830ff808b6f6a0b29ccedeca588616
Closes-Bug: #1535707
"}]
commit_message:
Router namespace not created in controller

When creating a router with an external network attached
from the Create Router form a router namespace doesn't
get created on the controller.

By calling the correct APIs, the namespace get
created.

To check the namespace list run the below command
on controller node.
'sudo ip netns list'

Change-Id: I829c707353830ff808b6f6a0b29ccedeca588616
Closes-Bug: #1535707

revisions:

When deploying a ppc64el compute node, smt needs to be
turned off and cpu-mode needs to be set to host-passthrough
for nova/libvirt/kvm use.

Change-Id: I48bd8f9e42dbc5f7c626addaa2fdd1e3f8fdd97e
'}]
commit_message:
Set smt off and cpu-mode to host-passthrough for ppc64 architectures

When deploying a ppc64el compute node, smt needs to be
turned off and cpu-mode needs to be set to host-passthrough
for nova/libvirt/kvm use.

Change-Id: I48bd8f9e42dbc5f7c626addaa2fdd1e3f8fdd97e

Switched from fixtures to mock to mock out starting RPC consumers

fixtures 2.0.0 broke us wildly, so instead of trying to make it work
with new fixtures, I better just switch the mock to... mock.

Closes-Bug: #1567295

Conflicts:
	neutron/tests/base.py

Change-Id: Idee580b7799493ed39c53f923083ae6aba92cf4f

commit_message:
messaging: remove RequestContextSerializer

We don't pass any oslo.context object around anymore, we just pass dict
if we really need to send some context information – which we barely
need actually.

And remove oslo.context!

Change-Id: I17d15c043b5c7d508af9a43f50511817f9e81151

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-03-09 10:34:06.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py'], 'message': "Don't convert raw disks to qcow2 during resize/migrate

Change I792e0fb986a6c5cf9ac477cef0949c8a40099faa unconditionally
converts all raw disks to qcow2 if use_cow_images is set to True. This
includes config disks, which are intended to be unconditionally raw.
We weren't noticing this previously, as a subsequent bug meant that
the config disk was unconditionally overwritten with a new, raw one.

The original reason given for doing is adequately handled in
_disk_resize above.

Related-Bug: #1548884
Change-Id: I384a7a7fb989cb8a423c669b9af9cda684771cb5
"}]
commit_message:
Don't convert raw disks to qcow2 during resize/migrate

Change I792e0fb986a6c5cf9ac477cef0949c8a40099faa unconditionally
converts all raw disks to qcow2 if use_cow_images is set to True. This
includes config disks, which are intended to be unconditionally raw.
We weren't noticing this previously, as a subsequent bug meant that
the config disk was unconditionally overwritten with a new, raw one.

The original reason given for doing is adequately handled in
_disk_resize above.

Related-Bug: #1548884
Change-Id: I384a7a7fb989cb8a423c669b9af9cda684771cb5

- Install mapr-hive and mapr-hbase packages
  on Spark node when Hive and HBase are
  installed on nodes different from Spark.
- Copy hive-site.xml and hbase-site.xml to
  Spark node.

Change-Id: I0087cba69d8d1225c0baa0c7e31fb139aa57cb4a
Closes-Bug: #1560027
'}]
commit_message:
Correctly configure Spark with Hive, HBase

- Correctly determine where Hive and
  Hbase are installed.
- Add property to hbase-site.xml to
  correctly integrate Hbase with Spark.
- Install mapr-hive and mapr-hbase packages
  on Spark node when Hive and HBase are
  installed on nodes different from Spark.
- Copy hive-site.xml and hbase-site.xml to
  Spark node.

Change-Id: I0087cba69d8d1225c0baa0c7e31fb139aa57cb4a
Closes-Bug: #1560027

commit_message:
Update firewall module version

The package "iptables-persistent" wasn't installed
when facter trying to get version. Update of module has
Facter.flush method call to clear Facter cache.

Change-Id: I0bbe0805f6f8d8c2bd9e5436e7c2019aa18e6090
Closes-Bug: #1565683

as of the liberty release, keystone has emitted deprecation warnings
when groups were created without a domain id specified; keystone would
fall back to using the default domain specified in keystone.conf.

as of newton, this fallback is being removed in favor of always
specifying the domain id, and raising an exception if it is not present.

Change-Id: I6004644531c2e86cafe3714451101e6b977a8593
Needed-By: I0b061c7df45c10b419c0b1474c9217c4402f70fb
'}]
commit_message:
include domain_id when creating groups

as of the liberty release, keystone has emitted deprecation warnings
when groups were created without a domain id specified; keystone would
fall back to using the default domain specified in keystone.conf.

as of newton, this fallback is being removed in favor of always
specifying the domain id, and raising an exception if it is not present.

Change-Id: I6004644531c2e86cafe3714451101e6b977a8593
Needed-By: I0b061c7df45c10b419c0b1474c9217c4402f70fb

commit_message:
Add RadosGW readiness check

After radosgw service start it requires some time to get operational state
This change introduces check script which waits until radosgw start to serve
http requests.

Change-Id: Iaeb3f60c0da114de1fea3f0ec3aa69acd05b037a
Closes-bug: #1545651

subject: Add removal of the /etc/resolv.conf.save file for +bug/1567004
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-08 06:07:01.000000000', 'files': ['extraconfig/tasks/major_upgrade_pacemaker_init.yaml'], 'message': "Add removal of the /etc/resolv.conf.save file for +bug/1567004

The change at https://review.openstack.org/#/c/302352/ should stop
the if up/down scripts from making changes to resolv.conf as
discussed in that review and the related bug below. However during
upgrades, as we are moving from a version of the ifcfg-vlanXX files
that don't have the PEERDNS=no added by /#/c/302352 the if up
script will restore the /etc/resolv.conf.save to /etc/resolv.conf
and overwrite it. This removes the .save file during the upgrade
init command which gets delivered to all nodes as the first stage
of a major upgrade.

Change-Id: I91dd139f43be4912c20d8661691bee2b662964d4
Related-Bug: 1567004
(cherry picked from commit 706c2fe4b62f95ac13ee800fc08e549180afc810)
"}]
commit_message:
Add removal of the /etc/resolv.conf.save file for +bug/1567004

The change at https://review.openstack.org/#/c/302352/ should stop
the if up/down scripts from making changes to resolv.conf as
discussed in that review and the related bug below. However during
upgrades, as we are moving from a version of the ifcfg-vlanXX files
that don't have the PEERDNS=no added by /#/c/302352 the if up
script will restore the /etc/resolv.conf.save to /etc/resolv.conf
and overwrite it. This removes the .save file during the upgrade
init command which gets delivered to all nodes as the first stage
of a major upgrade.

Change-Id: I91dd139f43be4912c20d8661691bee2b662964d4
Related-Bug: 1567004
(cherry picked from commit 706c2fe4b62f95ac13ee800fc08e549180afc810)

subject: Add removal of the /etc/resolv.conf.save file for +bug/1567004

Related-Bug: 1567004
(cherry picked from commit 706c2fe4b62f95ac13ee800fc08e549180afc810)

commit_message:
Add removal of the /etc/resolv.conf.save file for +bug/1567004

The change at https://review.openstack.org/#/c/302352/ should stop
the if up/down scripts from making changes to resolv.conf as
discussed in that review and the related bug below. However during
upgrades, as we are moving from a version of the ifcfg-vlanXX files
that don't have the PEERDNS=no added by /#/c/302352 the if up
script will restore the /etc/resolv.conf.save to /etc/resolv.conf
and overwrite it. This removes the .save file during the upgrade
init command which gets delivered to all nodes as the first stage
of a major upgrade.

Change-Id: I91dd139f43be4912c20d8661691bee2b662964d4
Related-Bug: 1567004
(cherry picked from commit 706c2fe4b62f95ac13ee800fc08e549180afc810)

commit_message:
remove complex capabilities for meter, resource and statistics

complex query functionalities for those there APIs are never exist
or plan to do so, leave it in capabilities is misleading to end user,
because they never can be True for any back end storage.

Change-Id: Ie1f640abe4970a0e6ea6fe076961855c9dca66e5
APIImpact: /v2/capabilities response removes some never used fields

subject: upload both sdist and wheel on pre-release
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-03-31 18:22:08.000000000', 'files': ['zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': 'upload both sdist and wheel on pre-release

We used to only upload wheels of pre-release packages to protect folks
who were using old versions of pip from having those things installed
"accidentally". It has been long enough, and we expect everyone to have
upgraded their pip by now, so update the job definitions so that when we
tag a pre-release we upload both the sdist and the wheel.

Change-Id: I7c1563b130ba5640f8d47c8795be64238532f56c
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}]
commit_message:
upload both sdist and wheel on pre-release

We used to only upload wheels of pre-release packages to protect folks
who were using old versions of pip from having those things installed
"accidentally". It has been long enough, and we expect everyone to have
upgraded their pip by now, so update the job definitions so that when we
tag a pre-release we upload both the sdist and the wheel.

Change-Id: I7c1563b130ba5640f8d47c8795be64238532f56c
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

subject: Enable src and non-src tinyipa jobs against Ironic
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-04-06 13:20:05.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/projects.yaml', 'zuul/layout.yaml', 'jenkins/jobs/devstack-gate.yaml'], 'message': 'Enable src and non-src tinyipa jobs against Ironic

Now that we have a post job against ironic-python-agent that builds and
publishes a tinyipa image to tarballs.openstack.org, we can optimise the
the Ironic tinyipa gate by using the pre-built image to speed up the
devstack process. Once the non-src job has proved its success then the
src job will be removed from the Ironic check queue.

Change-Id: I61606b37fa011f2ea91cfe7f391a37daafc4c0e1
Depends-On: I641a5afe8318ec0848395b2b70e056c448f3dd00
'}]
commit_message:
Enable src and non-src tinyipa jobs against Ironic

Now that we have a post job against ironic-python-agent that builds and
publishes a tinyipa image to tarballs.openstack.org, we can optimise the
the Ironic tinyipa gate by using the pre-built image to speed up the
devstack process. Once the non-src job has proved its success then the
src job will be removed from the Ironic check queue.

Change-Id: I61606b37fa011f2ea91cfe7f391a37daafc4c0e1
Depends-On: I641a5afe8318ec0848395b2b70e056c448f3dd00

subject: Don't use singleton dicts unwittingly
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-04-08 03:56:53.000000000', 'files': ['shade/operatorcloud.py'], 'message': "Don't use singleton dicts unwittingly

filters={} is dangerous because it creates a singleton re-usable dict
that will collect data over time. The correct python pattern is to pass
None as the parameter and then do if None: set to dict.

Change-Id: I90b233dc2b5dc17cb8180aa5786865c0d98358f5
"}]
commit_message:
Don't use singleton dicts unwittingly

filters={} is dangerous because it creates a singleton re-usable dict
that will collect data over time. The correct python pattern is to pass
None as the parameter and then do if None: set to dict.

Change-Id: I90b233dc2b5dc17cb8180aa5786865c0d98358f5

commit_message:
Adds distro-specific changes to make CI work

- Adds conditional for CentOS/RHEL and Ubuntu/Debian
- Disables gpgcheck for RDO
- Bumps release from liberty to mitaka
- Bumps RDO repo to Testing

subject: Update func tests for latest devstack flavors
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-04-07 19:40:09.000000000', 'files': ['shade/tests/functional/test_range_search.py'], 'message': 'Update func tests for latest devstack flavors

The most recent devstack adds new flavors to the existing set, so
we need to adjust some functional tests that are testing range
searches across flavors.

Note that we have a gate test that tests against stable/liberty
and that devstack still has the original m1 flavors only. So we
need to account for that in the functional tests.

Change-Id: I98ce866686f3243ef2d2800b872a9840761fbe1a
'}]
commit_message:
Update func tests for latest devstack flavors

The most recent devstack adds new flavors to the existing set, so
we need to adjust some functional tests that are testing range
searches across flavors.

Note that we have a gate test that tests against stable/liberty
and that devstack still has the original m1 flavors only. So we
need to account for that in the functional tests.

Change-Id: I98ce866686f3243ef2d2800b872a9840761fbe1a

commit_message:
Define context.roles with base class

In f383bd2973c58c5272504603e4f9dddd55c5bb68, oslo.context (2.2.0)

super()__init__.

Updated to_dict() to use base class method first.

revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2016-03-29 09:01:44.000000000', 'files': ['heat_integrationtests/functional/test_os_wait_condition.py'], 'message': "Increase timeout of WaitCondition due to ConcurrentTransactions

Currently we have retry logic with random period of delay.
There is a chance, when we have several re-try attemts with maximum
timeout, so it can be a root cause of floating fails, when we have not
enough time for getting all signals.

Also decrease number of signals from 30 to 25, due to small risk, when
one of signals goes to ConcurrentTransaction error.

Note, that all these changes are made in corresponding functional test
and don't affect main code.

Change-Id: I9ca85c4378d0f62e316f4f40ff73597ffaaabadf
Related-Bug: #1497274
"}]
commit_message:
Increase timeout of WaitCondition due to ConcurrentTransactions

Currently we have retry logic with random period of delay.
There is a chance, when we have several re-try attemts with maximum
timeout, so it can be a root cause of floating fails, when we have not
enough time for getting all signals.

Also decrease number of signals from 30 to 25, due to small risk, when
one of signals goes to ConcurrentTransaction error.

Note, that all these changes are made in corresponding functional test
and don't affect main code.

Change-Id: I9ca85c4378d0f62e316f4f40ff73597ffaaabadf
Related-Bug: #1497274

commit_message:
Fix Hue integration with Spark and Hive

- When Spark and Hue are installed on different nodes
  hue-livy must be installed on the Spark node.
- Change permissions for hue-livy directory.
- Connect to hive server address instead of metastore.

Closes-Bug: #1560118
Change-Id: Ie036b10d776e24c2feb45039bff81853a39373ec

subject: libvirt: pci detach devices should use dev.address
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-05 07:57:52.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_driver.py'], 'message': "libvirt: pci detach devices should use dev.address

The _detach_pci_devices gets pci_devs which is list
of PciDevice objects. The code that check if pci is
detach is using dev['address'] and as not in the obj
format dev.address.

Closes-Bug: #1565466

Change-Id: I9ba58707d03d19018a025d7760f2a77f84d23aad
(cherry picked from commit 871368bc65eb9ededd053055c35673dbb61dd3ad)
"}]
commit_message:
libvirt: pci detach devices should use dev.address

The _detach_pci_devices gets pci_devs which is list
of PciDevice objects. The code that check if pci is
detach is using dev['address'] and as not in the obj
format dev.address.

Closes-Bug: #1565466

Change-Id: I9ba58707d03d19018a025d7760f2a77f84d23aad
(cherry picked from commit 871368bc65eb9ededd053055c35673dbb61dd3ad)

commit_message:
Define context.roles with base class

In f383bd2973c58c5272504603e4f9dddd55c5bb68, oslo.context (2.2.0)
added roles support in the context itself. This passes roles to
super()__init__.

Cleanup of to_dict() to construct initially with base class.

Change-Id: I688eed81bfeddd9455121ac0ce1b6903bf8d5e87
