commit_message:
SPI Method to Validate Images

Adds SPI method and utility module to Sahara. Does not yet include any
yaml files or plugin implementations in this change set; early
implementations are in the works for testing but not yet ready for
review, and will come in separate commits for modularity.

Partially-implements: blueprint validate-image-spi
Change-Id: I9f59219a801325176a70fd8da1ca3b38efc5b109

subject: Add openstack/monasca-transform project
revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2016-04-07 18:58:37.000000000', 'files': ['gerrit/acls/openstack/monasca-transform.config', 'gerrit/projects.yaml', 'zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': 'Add openstack/monasca-transform project

The monasca-transform project is a new component in Monasca that
will aggregate and transform metrics. For example, it will consume
metrics for Swift from the Monasca metrics topic and count the total
number of times a container or object is accessed and group them by
project. Then it will publish the aggregated metric to the Kafka
metrics topic where the rest of the existing Monasca components
will be used to store, alarm and notify.

Change-Id: I7826768e174a229bc184ea38d75d212ac957e26c
Needed-By: I9227a6afb468e05aaeb939930b872d1c64f79551
'}]
commit_message:
Add openstack/monasca-transform project

The monasca-transform project is a new component in Monasca that
will aggregate and transform metrics. For example, it will consume
metrics for Swift from the Monasca metrics topic and count the total
number of times a container or object is accessed and group them by
project. Then it will publish the aggregated metric to the Kafka
metrics topic where the rest of the existing Monasca components
will be used to store, alarm and notify.

Change-Id: I7826768e174a229bc184ea38d75d212ac957e26c
Needed-By: I9227a6afb468e05aaeb939930b872d1c64f79551

commit_message:
Overwrite Usage class's get() function

base.Resource's get function will call its manager's get() function
with one parameter. However UsageManager's get function takes three
parameters.

Change-Id: I958a55c4d52cec4d1177371b788b3cf788098a6c
Closes-bug: 1552616

subject: Add Windows as supported operating system
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-07 16:26:41.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_requirements/cmds/edit_constraint.py', 'openstack_requirements/project.py', 'setup.cfg'], 'message': 'Add Windows as supported operating system

This change is necessary in order to use the project's
update-requirements.py script when preparing the environment on the
Hyper-V compute nodes used in the Hyper-V CI. Using the mentioned script
will set the latest requirements in nova, neutron, manila, etc.,
reducing the CI's amount of failures caused by outdated requirements.

Including Microsoft Windows as a supported operating system on this
project. Also, we update the edit-constraints.py and project.py
files to support os.rename() of Windows.

On Windows, os.rename() will create a file with the source
name, without deleting the initial file first.

Example of a traceback:

 Traceback (most recent call last):
   File "C:\Python27\Scripts\edit-constraints-script.py", line 9, in
 <module>
     load_entry_point('openstack.requirements==0.0.1.dev2497',
 'console_scripts', 'edit-constraints')()
   File
 "C:\Python27\lib\site-packages\openstack_requirements\cmds\edit_constraint.py",
 line 74, in main
     os.rename(args[0] + '.tmp', args[0])
 WindowsError: [Error 183] Cannot create a file when that file already exists

This could be easily solved by removing the file before the rename.

Proposed fix:
Add before "os.rename(args[0] + '.tmp', args[0])" the line "os.remove(args[0])"
in edit_constraint.py
Add before "os.rename(tmpname, fullname)" the line "os.remove(fullname)"
in project.py
Add "Operating System :: Microsoft :: Windows" in setup.cfg

DocImpact: Added Windows as a supported OS in setup.cfg
Change-Id: If123a65fd8d49d5c67a1db16827a9617ce520dba
Signed-off-by: Costin Galan <cgalan@cloudbasesolutions.com>
(cherry picked from commit 7bca31945156f9d411b3dc8e11b93dfd2a63448d)
'}]
commit_message:
Add Windows as supported operating system

This change is necessary in order to use the project's
update-requirements.py script when preparing the environment on the
Hyper-V compute nodes used in the Hyper-V CI. Using the mentioned script
will set the latest requirements in nova, neutron, manila, etc.,
reducing the CI's amount of failures caused by outdated requirements.

Including Microsoft Windows as a supported operating system on this
project. Also, we update the edit-constraints.py and project.py
files to support os.rename() of Windows.

On Windows, os.rename() will create a file with the source
name, without deleting the initial file first.

Example of a traceback:

 Traceback (most recent call last):
   File "C:\Python27\Scripts\edit-constraints-script.py", line 9, in
 <module>
     load_entry_point('openstack.requirements==0.0.1.dev2497',
 'console_scripts', 'edit-constraints')()
   File
 "C:\Python27\lib\site-packages\openstack_requirements\cmds\edit_constraint.py",
 line 74, in main
     os.rename(args[0] + '.tmp', args[0])
 WindowsError: [Error 183] Cannot create a file when that file already exists

This could be easily solved by removing the file before the rename.

Proposed fix:
Add before "os.rename(args[0] + '.tmp', args[0])" the line "os.remove(args[0])"
in edit_constraint.py
Add before "os.rename(tmpname, fullname)" the line "os.remove(fullname)"
in project.py
Add "Operating System :: Microsoft :: Windows" in setup.cfg

DocImpact: Added Windows as a supported OS in setup.cfg
Change-Id: If123a65fd8d49d5c67a1db16827a9617ce520dba
Signed-off-by: Costin Galan <cgalan@cloudbasesolutions.com>
(cherry picked from commit 7bca31945156f9d411b3dc8e11b93dfd2a63448d)

commit_message:
Do not cat npm-shrinkwrap.json

Upload it to logs instead. This is done because we suspect that
executing cat on a large text file does not play well with
jenkins.

Change-Id: I8512c9b132f2707db265633d5e16378b1d87d4da

subject: Support backward compatibility of L2population
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-01-29 11:25:50.000000000', 'files': ['networking_sfc/services/sfc/drivers/ovs/driver.py'], 'message': 'Support backward compatibility of L2population

This patch will resolve this reported bug.
https://bugs.launchpad.net/networking-sfc/+bug/1539493

Under the service chain across different network(subnet) scenario,
if there is no entry of next hop sf in local host, the packet will
be broadcasted to nexthop(sf), even if l2 pop is enabled. eg,
	host1(network1 vm#1)->host2(network2 vm#2).

So, below patch was raised to install a fdb entry to resolve this
issue.
	https://review.openstack.org/#/c/227285/ patch set 52
And this patch import the l2pop driver object. However, the L2population
driver was reconstructed in the mitaka, after upgrade to mitaka,
some error is accurred.

This patch will support backward compatibility with Liberty too.

Change-Id: I6fc8b84f2ffd3bd7129bfacef5f02ad5fa0d96bd
'}]
commit_message:
Support backward compatibility of L2population

This patch will resolve this reported bug.
https://bugs.launchpad.net/networking-sfc/+bug/1539493

Under the service chain across different network(subnet) scenario,
if there is no entry of next hop sf in local host, the packet will
be broadcasted to nexthop(sf), even if l2 pop is enabled. eg,
	host1(network1 vm#1)->host2(network2 vm#2).

So, below patch was raised to install a fdb entry to resolve this
issue.
	https://review.openstack.org/#/c/227285/ patch set 52
And this patch import the l2pop driver object. However, the L2population
driver was reconstructed in the mitaka, after upgrade to mitaka,
some error is accurred.

This patch will support backward compatibility with Liberty too.

Change-Id: I6fc8b84f2ffd3bd7129bfacef5f02ad5fa0d96bd

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 6796, 'name': 'Giulio Fidente', 'email': 'gfidente@redhat.com', 'username': 'gfidente'}, {'_account_id': 8042, 'name': 'Jiří Stránský', 'email': 'jistr@redhat.com', 'username': 'jistr'}, {'_account_id': 8449, 'name': 'Marios Andreou', 'email': 'marios.andreou@gmail.com', 'username': 'marios'}, {'_account_id': 9979, 'name': 'Mike Burns', 'email': 'mburns@redhat.com', 'username': 'mburns'}, {'_account_id': 20777, 'name': 'Alejandro Siller Rivas', 'email': 'alejandro.rivas@ericsson.com', 'username': 'alexsiller'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-04-07 13:50:33.000000000', 'files': ['extraconfig/tasks/major_upgrade_pacemaker_init.yaml'], 'message': "Add removal of the /etc/resolv.conf.save file for +bug/1567004

The change at https://review.openstack.org/#/c/302352/ should stop
the if up/down scripts from making changes to resolv.conf as
discussed in that review and the related bug below. However during
upgrades, as we are moving from a version of the ifcfg-vlanXX files
that don't have the PEERDNS=no added by /#/c/302352 the if up
script will restore the /etc/resolv.conf.save to /etc/resolv.conf
and overwrite it. This removes the .save file during the upgrade
init command which gets delivered to all nodes as the first stage
of a major upgrade.

Change-Id: I91dd139f43be4912c20d8661691bee2b662964d4
Related-Bug: 1567004
"}]
commit_message:
Add removal of the /etc/resolv.conf.save file for +bug/1567004

The change at https://review.openstack.org/#/c/302352/ should stop
the if up/down scripts from making changes to resolv.conf as
discussed in that review and the related bug below. However during
upgrades, as we are moving from a version of the ifcfg-vlanXX files
that don't have the PEERDNS=no added by /#/c/302352 the if up
script will restore the /etc/resolv.conf.save to /etc/resolv.conf
and overwrite it. This removes the .save file during the upgrade
init command which gets delivered to all nodes as the first stage
of a major upgrade.

Change-Id: I91dd139f43be4912c20d8661691bee2b662964d4
Related-Bug: 1567004

revisions:
[{'number': 11, 'created': '2016-04-06 17:34:52.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/agent/l3/dvr_fip_ns.py', 'neutron/agent/linux/keepalived.py', 'neutron/agent/l3/item_allocator.py'], 'message': 'DVR: Increase the link-local address pair range

The current dvr_fip_ns.py file has FIP_LL_SUBNET configured
with a subnet prefixlen of /23 which only allows 255 pairs of
link-local addresses to be generated. If the number of routers
per-node increases beyond the 255 limit it raises an assertion.

This patch increases the link-local address cidr to be a /18
to allow for 8K routers. The new range was chosen to not
overlap with the original, allowing for in-place upgrades
without affecting existing routers.

Closes-Bug: #1562110
Change-Id: I6e11622ea9cc74b1d2428757f16aa0de504ac31a
'}]
commit_message:
DVR: Increase the link-local address pair range

The current dvr_fip_ns.py file has FIP_LL_SUBNET configured
with a subnet prefixlen of /23 which only allows 255 pairs of
link-local addresses to be generated. If the number of routers
per-node increases beyond the 255 limit it raises an assertion.

This patch increases the link-local address cidr to be a /18
to allow for 8K routers. The new range was chosen to not
overlap with the original, allowing for in-place upgrades
without affecting existing routers.

Closes-Bug: #1562110
Change-Id: I6e11622ea9cc74b1d2428757f16aa0de504ac31a

subject: [install] Swift updates for Mitaka
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-04-04 15:00:55.000000000', 'files': ['doc/install-guide/source/swift-controller-install.rst', 'doc/install-guide/source/swift-verify.rst', 'doc/install-guide/source/swift-finalize-installation.rst', 'doc/install-guide/source/swift-storage-install.rst', 'doc/install-guide/source/swift-controller-include.txt'], 'message': '[install] Swift updates for Mitaka

Update swift configuration for Mitaka.

1) Change configuration file branch from liberty to mitaka.
2) Change keystone middleware to use domain name instead of
   domain ID.
3) Use OpenStack client instead of swift client to download
   object. Considerably slower, but works.
4) Remove workaround for using the Identity v3 API because
   the entire guide continues to use "versioned" endpoints.

Implements: bp installguide-mitaka
Change-Id: I3115c11b55764dc321459d7e9f11b49982cdd11e
'}]
commit_message:
[install] Swift updates for Mitaka

Update swift configuration for Mitaka.

1) Change configuration file branch from liberty to mitaka.
2) Change keystone middleware to use domain name instead of
   domain ID.
3) Use OpenStack client instead of swift client to download
   object. Considerably slower, but works.
4) Remove workaround for using the Identity v3 API because
   the entire guide continues to use "versioned" endpoints.

Implements: bp installguide-mitaka
Change-Id: I3115c11b55764dc321459d7e9f11b49982cdd11e

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 6659, 'name': 'Paul Michali', 'email': 'pc@michali.net', 'username': 'pcm'}, {'_account_id': 7448, 'name': 'Carl Baldwin', 'email': 'carl@ecbaldwin.net', 'username': 'carl-baldwin'}, {'_account_id': 10692, 'name': 'Brocade Vyatta CI', 'email': 'DL-GRP-VYATTA-OSS@Brocade.com', 'username': 'brocade-oss-service', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 12403, 'name': 'Al Miller', 'email': 'al.miller@ajmiller.net', 'username': 'ajmiller'}, {'_account_id': 17455, 'name': 'Na Zhu', 'email': 'juno.zhu@huawei.com', 'username': 'Na'}, {'_account_id': 17609, 'name': 'steve', 'email': 'ruansx@cn.ibm.com', 'username': 'steve.ruan'}, {'_account_id': 17699, 'name': 'Yi Jing Zhu', 'email': 'nick.zhuyj@cn.ibm.com', 'username': 'nick.zhuyj'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-04-06 04:56:16.000000000', 'files': ['neutron_vpnaas/tests/unit/services/vpn/device_drivers/test_ipsec.py', 'neutron_vpnaas/services/vpn/device_drivers/ipsec.py'], 'message': 'OpenSwan: handle disconnect properly for multiple subnets

When mutiple subnets configured in one connection thru endpoint group.
the connection name suffix shown in ipsec status is not always as 0x1
but something like 08d11cfb-dc15-43e2-aee3-c2c71e6ae8e3/1x1 and 1x2 etc.
In this patch, we get the exact connection names from the status output
and then terminate them one by one in a loop.

Closes-Bug: #1564745
Change-Id: I2fa4eb7a7df1500b628abc31f89491ef61deb464
'}]
commit_message:
OpenSwan: handle disconnect properly for multiple subnets

When mutiple subnets configured in one connection thru endpoint group.
the connection name suffix shown in ipsec status is not always as 0x1
but something like 08d11cfb-dc15-43e2-aee3-c2c71e6ae8e3/1x1 and 1x2 etc.
In this patch, we get the exact connection names from the status output
and then terminate them one by one in a loop.

Closes-Bug: #1564745
Change-Id: I2fa4eb7a7df1500b628abc31f89491ef61deb464

commit_message:
Add publisher's table

Add publisher's table to DF distributed DB. Have publishers register to
that table when they load. Have publishers update the last activity
timestamp when an event is sent. Have the publisher service monitor the
table for stale publishers, and remove them.

Change-Id: I5efb800cbee310cf420c12c3dbf0be8bb7ed3aa6

subject: Enable to share PCI devices between NUMA nodes.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-07 09:31:31.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/virt/test_hardware.py', 'nova/conf/pci.py', 'nova/pci/stats.py'], 'message': "Enable to share PCI devices between NUMA nodes.

If you want to share PCI devices between numa nodes you
should add config option 'share_pci_between_numa_nodes=True'
in default section of nova.conf.
By default value of this option is 'False'.

You should apply this patch on your controllers and
on your computes. Also should add new option
'share_pci_between_numa_nodes' to the nova config file
on your controllers and on your computes.

Change-Id: I64c3ccbc29e08e5bdcaf6bb67ad459bcee245b38
"}]
commit_message:
Enable to share PCI devices between NUMA nodes.

If you want to share PCI devices between numa nodes you
should add config option 'share_pci_between_numa_nodes=True'
in default section of nova.conf.
By default value of this option is 'False'.

You should apply this patch on your controllers and
on your computes. Also should add new option
'share_pci_between_numa_nodes' to the nova config file
on your controllers and on your computes.

Change-Id: I64c3ccbc29e08e5bdcaf6bb67ad459bcee245b38
